div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Good afternoon,

This is your very proud principal Mrs. Calnon with a few important updates. Governor Cuomo has announced that schools will remain closed until May 15th. We will return to school on May 18th unless the Governor extends the period of school closure.

Earlier today CCS delivered instructional packets to our Pre-K through grade 5 students. The instructional packet is designed to provide your child with activities to complete over the next two weeks. Remember, our teachers love to see your child’s work. Please take pictures of your child’s work and email it to your child’s teacher, post the work in the classroom Facebook group or post the work in the Google Classroom. We want your child to be proud of the work that they are completing and as educators we want to be able to provide them with feedback so that our students are able to continually improve their skills.

This week we have started to broadcast morning announcements. Please tune in to the CCS morning announcements each morning at 8:00 on our CCS Facebook page. We will have our student morning announcement crew assisting with the morning announcements. We will also have one of our amazing staff members assist with morning announcements each Friday! Tune in each morning at 8:00 am for the CCS morning announcements.

This morning on morning announcements, I shared that our second through sixth graders have a very important goal to meet this week! I have challenged our second through sixth grade students to pass one i-ready reading and one i–Ready Math lesson each day this week. This means that in order to meet their goal, our students will need to pass five Reading and five Math lessons by Friday afternoon! I know that our little Bulldogs can meet their goal!

I know that this is a very difficult time. That being said, I feel such pride to live and work in this amazing community. Thank you for continuing to work so diligently with your children. Thank you for supporting our amazing educators during this difficult time. We are very blessed to live in this wonderful community and to be a part of the Chateaugay Central School Bulldog Family.
Please contact either myself or your child’s teacher if you are in need of anything. We are here to assist in any way that we can. Please, be well. - Mrs. Calnon

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Boys and girls, are you ready for your next writing challenge? I hope that you just shouted a very loud, "YES!" Wednesday, April 22nd is Administrative Professionals Day. Our wonderful Elementary Secretary is Mrs. Courtney Parmeter. Boys and girls, I know how much you love Mrs. Parmeter. She always welcomes you into the elementary office with a warm smile and kind words. Mrs. Parmeter is so helpful to everyone; our students, parents, teachers and visitors to CCS. Most importantly, Mrs. Parmeter is an absolute joy to be around. We are very fortunate that Mrs. Parmeter is our Elementary Secretary! This week let's send letters and pictures to Mrs. Parmeter! I know that your letters and pictures will put a big smile on her face! Keep up the great work little Bulldogs! I am proud of you! - Love, Mrs. Calnon
Mrs. Courtney Parmeter
1199 County Route 35
Chateaugay, NY 12920
Thanky you, Mrs. Harrigan, for sharing this resource.

span.span: Steve Hartman teaches an online class on Optimism.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: To all students who receive Occupational Therapy services: NEW

div.p: We will be posting a google doc on the school website PreK-6 page that will be updated weekly with activities that you can complete on your own time. The OT staff will be notifying you when the activities are updated weekly via the remind app. Please text @otccs to 81010 to be added to the list for reminders, and to use this app to communicate with the OT staff.
If you prefer to email you can reach us at j.vanderwalker@chateaugaycsd.org (Jessica Vanderwalker) and j.zenger@chateaugaycsd.org (Josh Zenger).

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Mrs. Campbell has set up her own Google Classroom with the code: 6mhtqud . She will post some writing prompts and ask questions about what everyone has been reading. Sounds fun. Add her class from your existing Google Classroom page.
Also - check out her YouTube channel.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: New - Miss Hunt has started a Facebook Page to help her post some activities and ideas for her student. Check it out.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Did you know that one of Mrs. Calnon’s favorite things when she was a little girl was to receive a letter in the mail? It always made me feel so special. Boys and girls, I would love you to send me a letter either in the mail or by email. I promise I will respond! I would love to hear about all of the things that you have been doing during our time apart. I miss you very much, Little Bulldogs!
Love, Mrs. Calnon
Nicole Calnon
PO Box 205
Chateaugay, NY 12920

I had a few requests to post these all in one place. I chose activities that are suitable for almost every grade level and scale in difficulty from younger learners to seasoned math problem solvers. There are additional links provided on each Google Doc.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

h3.div: Print this out and hear outside for a walk. Thank you Mrs. Harrigan for sending this in.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Here is a list of how teachers in the elementary grades will be communicating to parents and students and how they will be proving materials.

ul.li: Attention elementary families: ABC Mouse is offering a free membership. Please go to ABCmouse.com/redeem and use the code: SCHOOL5836. Enjoy, Little Bulldogs!
Ms. Swinton's Pre-K 3: Ms. Swinton has set up a Facebook group and will continue to provide instructional ideas to our families through the group.
Mrs. Swanston: Instructional materials sent home in the mail.
Mrs. McComb: Mrs. McComb has and will continue to reach out to the parents of her students with instructional ideas.
Kindergarten: Instructional materials sent home in the mail.
First Grade: Instructional materials sent home in the mail.
Second Grade: Instructional materials sent home in the mail.
Third Grade: Instructional materials sent home in the mail.
Fourth Grade: Instructional materials sent home in the mail. Google classroom will be utilized. Classroom Code: Mr. Calnon - Grade 4 - xiqwdis .
Fifth Grade: Instructional materials sent home in the mail. Instructional materials can also be found in the fifth grade folder on our CCS website.
Sixth Grade: Instructional materials can be found in the sixth grade folder on our CCS website. Please contact CCS if you are in need of a paper copy.

h3.div: All instructional materials will be mailed home on March 18, 2020.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

ul.li: Articulation Pictures - some ways to practice articulation at home. CLICK HERE for more ideas.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: We have been thinking of different ways to help our parents and students during this time apart. We have added some general information to the website, including activities you can do with your child. We have also sent home packets to some families, but because of the short notice we were unable to give a lot of direction. Our therapy is very individualized and it is difficult to give information to whole groups. If anyone would like to email us and receive ideas and/or activities specifically geared to your child’s level and areas of need, we would be happy to do so. We are here to support you in any way you need.
Take care,

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
